title: The Availability Bias: How to Overcome a Common Cognitive Distortion
excerpt: We tend to judge the likelihood and significance of things based on how easily they come to mind. The more ‚Äúavailable‚Äù a piece of information is to us, the more important it seems. The result is that we give greater weight to information we learned recently because a news article you read last night comes to mind easier than a science class you took years ago. It‚Äôs too much work to try to comb through every piece of information that might be in our heads.
